overview: From 2025-10-02 to 2025-10-03, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 8 new PRs (11 merged), 5 new issues, and 22 active contributors.

topIssues.title: [Tracker] Isthmus Upgrade
topIssues.author: smartcontracts
topIssues.body:
This is out of date

General tracking for features proposed to be included in the Isthmus upgrade.

## Pre-requisite

- [x] #13069 

## Isthmus Candidates

### Smart contract work

- [ ] #11527
    - [ ] [Implementation](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/12356)
    - [x] [PR: make Cannon libraries version agnostic](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/13175)
- [ ] #11558 
- [ ] #12478 
    - [ ] [Design Doc](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/design-docs/pull/143)
    - [ ] [Implementation]()
- [ ] #13058 
    - [x] [PR: import statement cleanup](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/13056)
    - [x] [PR: move interfaces to new top-level folder](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/13114)
- [x] #11093 
    - [x] [PR: fix stack too deep error in PermissionedDisputeGame](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/13141)
    - [x] [PR: fix stack too deep error in MIPS](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/13137)
    - [x] [PR: fix stack too deep in LibKeccak](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/13136)
- [ ]  #12172
- [ ] Include Custom Gas Token code

### Other features

- [x] #12044 
  - [x] [PR op-geth: Isthmus: Tests and misc updates for L2 withdrawals root](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/op-geth/pull/399) 
  - [x] [PR op-geth: Isthmus: withdrawals root in block header](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/op-geth/pull/451)
  - [x] [PR: Config: Add support for Isthmus](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/12847)
  - [x] [PR: Updates for withdrawals root in block header](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/13962)
  - [x] [PR: op-program use withdrawalRoot from header if Isthmus](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/14180)
  - [ ] [PR: Action Tests](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/12925)
- [x] [Operator Fee](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/specs/pull/382)
    - [ ] [Design Doc](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/design-docs/pull/81/files)
- [ ] [Header Accumulator](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/specs/pull/259)
- [x] https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/specs/issues/511

## Probably NGMI this time

- [x] #12435
- [ ] [Deposit Queue](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/specs/pull/82)
- [ ] [Decouple block times between L1 and L2 (or L2 and L3)](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/specs/issues/416)

---
NB - the above is all subject to further discussion and agreement; nothing is set in stone just yet. But we are no longer taking further submissions for Isthmus (unless they are extraordinarily important).

topIssues.title: L2CL<>L2EL: Find out condition of L2EL for starting EL Syncing
topIssues.author: pcw109550
topIssues.body:
Find out the condition of EL that EL is able to EL Sync. This may differ by node implementations/networks and first priority is op-geth with op-sepolia.

We need this because when we do multiple EL Sync, we need to make the EL be able to EL Sync again.

Some artifacts(not confirmed):
> op-geth must not have finalized block to trigger EL Sync(snap sync).

Necessary for removal of ReqRes Sync to EL Sync. Must understand the starting conditions of EL Sync to rely on it.

topIssues.title: Extend lint-forge-tests-check-no-build to handle library artifacts
topIssues.author: aliersh
topIssues.body:
Currently, the lint-forge-tests-check-no-build script excludes test files under test/libraries/ due to limitations in how it processes artifacts for Solidity libraries. The script assumes contract-style ABIs and cannot reliably introspect functions in libraries, even if they follow the correct naming convention.

Most library tests have already been refactored to follow the style guide, but they remain excluded from validation for now. This issue tracks:

- Updating the script to properly handle library artifacts
- Enabling lint validation for test/libraries/ folder
- Removing library tests from the exclusion list

Related PR comment: [#16614 (comment)](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/16614#discussion_r2193273907)

topIssues.title: op-node: prepare for Fusaka
topIssues.author: geoknee
topIssues.body:
We need to ensure compatibility in the following areas:

1. Derivation pipeline. 

Converting excess blob gas into the L1cost. We need to hardcode the Fusaka and blob parameter only hardfork [EIP 7892](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7892) activation times, which vary by L1 chain. We can then editing this code accordingly, : 

https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/blob/44d3429d2913c8c90fbb0848e14c1022b8ca2267/op-service/eth/blob.go#L286-L308

It should be sufficient to simply modify the dummyConfig to schedule the various forks according to some lookup keyed by the L1 chain ID. Then, the upstream code will handle applying the right blob parameters. 


2. API related code. 

Are we able to fetch data from L1 after Fusaka?

---
Note that in future work we may be able to avoid hardcoding the per-fork blob parameters and read them from an  L1 RPC. However this is out of scope for this project.

We should also take account of[ EIP 7918](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7918) which bounds the blob base fee by execution cost. I don't believe this is a concern for compatibility, however,  and more for when we adopt that EIP on L2.

topIssues.title: L2CL: Document EL Sync behavior
topIssues.author: pcw109550
topIssues.body: op-node and kona-node has their own EL Sync behaviors, and their desired outcomes. The design is not well documented and this must be compiled as a doc.

topPRs.title: op-node,op-program,kona: embed L1ChainConfig in configuration
topPRs.author: geoknee
topPRs.body:
Since [Ecotone](https://specs.optimism.io/protocol/ecotone/l1-attributes.html), the L1BlockInfo deposit transaction couples the L2 state transition with the blob base fee of the l1 origin. The blob base fee is not part of the block, but rather computed from `block.excessBlobGas` with an [off-chain formula which varies according to which fork is active on L1.](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/op-geth/blob/51614a3dc4af4a2b503ba178e0799013e6774613/consensus/misc/eip4844/eip4844.go#L180-L197)

For the L2 state to accurately reflect the blob base fee of the l1 origin, it is necessary to provide the L2 consensus client information about the fork schedule of the L1 which it derives from.

This PR does that in a relatively lightweight way:
* for chains with a recognized l1 chain ID (such as all chains in the superchain registry), lookup the l1 chain config (either for Mainnet or Sepolia) using op-geth as a library. This information needs to be kept updated as new L1 forks (including BPO or blob parameter only forks) are scheduled in upstream geth and brought in through upstream merges. When this happens, we need to update the absolute prestate for the proofs system
* for custom chains (think devnets, test environments, chains which are not in the superchain registry) it is required to pass the l1 chain config via a new CLI flag. This can be directly JSON encoded or embedded in a `genesis.json` file.
* Does something similar for the op-program, which does not allow information to be passed at runtime but instead via filesystem embedding
* Also includes changes in this direction for kona

I avoided embedding the l1 chain config inside the `rollup.Config`, as that would require changing all of the data in the superchain registry.

This is a backwards compatible change which also makes the derivation pipeline compatible with post-Fusaka L1s.

The diff is quite large, mostly because there is a lot of boilerplate to change both in production and test code.

Closes #17493

topPRs.title: op-contracts: DeployOPChain.s.sol conform to input/output struct pattern
topPRs.author: bitwiseguy
topPRs.body:
Refactors `DeployOPChain.s.sol` so that it has the following `run` function definition:
```
function run(Types.DeployOPChainInput memory _input) public returns (Output memory output_)
```
The main driver of this change is to make it easier to invoke this script via our op-deployer go code (which will shell out to forge binary). But the refactor also has the following additional advantages:
* consistency with other `Deploy*.s.sol.run()` functions (uses input/output structs)
* more intuitive = better maintainability: previous `run` method wrote input/output values to contract storage, which then had to be read onchain instead of just getting a return value

topPRs.title: fix(op-deployer): avoid embedded artifacts recompilation
topPRs.author: serpixel
topPRs.body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**
Right now the artifacts get recompiled every time when using forge. This is an impediment to completing the forge migration.

- Downgrade forge to 1.1.0
- Avoid recompilation
- Custom tar files
- Switch compression method to zstd (10x reduction in filesize)

<!--
A clear and concise description of the features you're adding in this pull request.
-->

topPRs.title: op-e2e/actions: add L1 Osaka activation test
topPRs.author: geoknee
topPRs.body:
The test fails, which is **expected**.

This branch uses a custom "cherry-picked" build of op-geth ,

I verified locally that merging https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/17568 allow the test to pass.

completedItems.title: feat(test-validation): add library support
completedItems.body:
## Description

The test validator was failing for library tests because libraries with internal-only functions have empty ABIs (`methodIdentifiers: {}`). The validator checks function existence by looking at `artifact.Abi.Parsed.Methods`
